name: A Mage Imprisoned?
objective: free Vithal

first_task_locations.description: in the cavern north of here

quest_giver.name: Uder Mordin
quest_giver.description: a man who witnessed a battle between Vithal and a powerful opponent

reward.description: Vithal was trying to uncover an artifact of old

characters.name: Vithal
characters.description: a powerful male mage, who was magically confined

tools: NONE
description:
I would be careful in this place, if I were you. Many dangers around many corners. You will be lucky to live. No real secrets for those that travel here frequently.
A trespasser got his due from someone he crossed. Well, I suppose it did not end in death, but it was a mighty battle regardless. I do not know who the aggressor was, but I know who lost.
That person was a mage of power, I am sure, though not powerful enough in the end. A pity too. He seemed intent on unearthing an artifact of old or some such.
And his reward for his effort? Worse than death, even though he seemed willing to share. Imprisoned, magically confined in the cavern north of here. Pity.

name: A Mage's Proposal
objective: help Vithal breach the walls between dimensions

first_task_locations.description: a svirfneblin village to the north

reward.description: items for the player and Vithal

tools: the player released Vithal from imprisonment
Vithal lost his book of rituals
Vithal needs the book of rituals to breach the walls between dimensions
description:
Ahh! Thank you for releasing me. I'm Vithal, an adventuring mage. If you could aid me a bit, I would be forever grateful. There will be items enough for us both.
This spot is "thin," and careful spells may breach the walls between dimensions. On the other side, one might find some valuable magic, if one knows where to look. I cannot cast the actual dimension-breaching spells without the procedures outlined in my book of rituals. I imagine it was taken after I was imprisoned. There were svirfneblin observing my conflict: Perhaps they took it. I cannot blame them. I am sure I appeared quite permanently lost.
I believe there is a svirfneblin village to the north. They may have taken my gear there. If you go, tell them they may keep everything but the book.

druids are suspected of the animal attacks

I am Flydian, a messenger sent by the High Merchant of Trademeet to find someone to help our town.
Trademeet is under attack by forest animals. The High Merchant thinks druids may be responsible, but we haven't the manpower to find them and stop it.
The High Merchant will have more information for you.

I am Anomen, a warrior priest.
I must discover the truth about my sister's murder. We must head for my father's home in the Government District of Athkatla!

name: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Lathander
objective: convince Sir Sarles to sculpt a statue for the temple of Lathander

first_task_locations.name: Jysstev estate
first_task_locations.description: in Athkatla, southeast section of the Government District

tools: Dawnbringer Sain is supposed to acquire art for the temple of Lathander
description:
Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter.

name: Another Mission for the Temple of Lathander
objective: return Dawn Ring to the temple of Lathander
first_tasks: intercept the thieves transporting Dawn Ring
tools: there are many new artworks and aged relics on display at the temple of Lathander
Dawn Ring was stolen from the temple of Lathander
the thieves were hired by the Talassans of temple of Talos
description:
Good day, it's Dawnbringer Sain, the priest of Lathander.
I would ask a dangerous thing of you. You're free to refuse, but the greater glory of Lathander is at stake.
The Morninglord takes great pride in the artifacts of his rule. We have many items on display at the temple of Lathander, from new artworks to the aged relics of bygone days. Today we are one less. We are the victims of thievery, and our followers have been shaken by this vulnerability. Quick steps must be taken to rectify this.
We know the culprits; they have not concealed their crime. Talassans, slinking from their temple to degrade our worship, hired common thieves for the deed! They fear no retribution. The Morninglord cannot suffer his relics in the hands of such evil.
Find these thieves before the Talassans receive the items.
The spark of dawn has lit the way.
Go to the filth of the slums at night and intercept the delivery of our Dawn Ring. Bring it back to its proper place.

name: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Talos
objective: convince Sir Sarles to create a work of art for the temple of Talos

characters.name: Sir Sarles
characters.description: a good artist who is also a pretentious and demanding man

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the evil god of thunder and destruction

tools: Sir Sarles demands illithium as his art medium
if the player sees the representatives of the other churches, the player must kill them
description:
I, Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos, have a mission for you!
Talos demands proper tribute, and that occasionally means artwork pleasing to the eye. If a piece of his fury can be represented, more might see and fear it.
An artist visits Athkatla now. The artist travels under the name Sir Sarles, though it is surely a fake. He is pretentious, demanding, and very good.
We must command a commission from him. But he is not being cooperative. His commission is outlandish, and he demands illithium as his medium! He may as well have asked for dragon tears.
Convince him to work for Talos. Use whatever means you must. Other churches are trying the same... if you cross their representatives, kill them.
Incur what debts you must, and use force where it will help. Stop at nothing. This man must realize there is no choice but to work in the service of Talos.

name: Another Mission for the Temple of Talos
objective: get the Dawn Ring from Travin and bring it to Talon Yarryl

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the evil god of thunder and destruction

groups.name: Lathanderian temple, Lathanderian church
groups.description: a church that does not respect Talos

tools: Stormherald Nallabir lost this past tenday's theological debate to a a representative of the Lathanderian temple in the Government District
the temple of Talos hired Travin to steal a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple
description:
It's Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos.
I have a chore for you that may prove interesting.
This is not a matter of negotiation or exploration. No, now you are to face true enemies of Talos.
Slanderous words have been said. Things did not go well for Stormherald Nallabir at this past tenday's theological debate in the Government District. The growing arrogance of the Lathanderian church is distasteful. Talos should be feared; their irreverence is insulting.
We have hired a thief, and he has stolen a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple.
Find Travin in the slums at night, collect the ring, and return it here.
Remember that the honor of Talos rests upon your shoulders.

name: Bring the Poisoned Man to his Friends
objective: save Renfeld from dying of poison

first_task_locations.description: large orange building, in the southwest part of the Docks District

quest_giver.name: Renfeld
quest_giver.description: a man who has been poisoned

characters.name: Rylock
characters.location: the entrance to the large orange building

tools: Renfeld has friends nearby in a large orange building
Rylock is guarding the entrance to the large orange building
description:
My... my name is Renfeld...
*groan*
I have been poisoned...
I beg you to take me to... friends...
they have a building not far away from here... please, I beg you! It is a large building...
a large orange building in the southwest part of the Docks District.
There will be a man guarding the door... his name is Rylock. Please, take me to him...
I... I have nothing to offer you... aside from my gratitude and those of my friends.
Please... I do not have much time...

name: Captured by Mind Flayers
objective: survive the mind flayers' arena
tools: the player was captured by the mind flayers while trespassing their home
the mind flayers like watching their captives fight in the arena
the player should not attack the mind flayers
the player should not anger the arena spectators: they are especially strong because of their big brain
description:
Me a servant ogre. Now it time to fight!
You fight in the arena. Listen, I tell you what you need to know.
You trespass on the home of the mind flayers, and you got caught. Now you pay for your stay. Understand?
Next thing, you better fight well in the arena, because if you don't fight well, you die. If you don't fight at all, you die.
Oh, last rule, never attack the mind flayers. You are in their home. They kill you with their thoughts.
You will live if you fight well.
I warn though: Do not anger spectators. They extra strong in this place because of big brain.

name: Work as a Cleric for the Temple of Helm
objective: hear questions from believers of Helm
first_tasks: reassure believers of Helm that duty is above all

quest_giver.name: Acolyte Byron
quest_giver.description: the player's tutor in the player's duties to Helm

tools: the player is one of Helm's chosen: a cleric of Helm
description:
Greetings, I'm Acolyte Byron.
I will be your tutor in your duties here as one of Helm's chosen.
You have many things you are responsible for.
As a favored of Helm, you will hear questions from those that seek guidance in their duty. They merely needed to be reassured that duty is above all, and that reverence for such duty is the way to happiness.
You will steer them on the true path to Helm's grace.
You have the wisdom that has secured your position within the church.
You will dispense it to those that are needy.
This is a sacred trust that you are given. Do not disappoint.

name: Guide the Followers of Lathander
objective: lend your wisdom to the believers of Lathander
first_tasks: give guidance to someone that needs the guidance of Lathander

quest_giver.name: Lara
quest_giver.description: the player's tutor in the player's duties to Lathander

tools: the player is a cleric of Lathander, and one of Lathander's favored
Lara will send the player someone who needs the guidance of Lathander
description:
Hello there, I am Lara, and I shall be your tutor.
Not that you need schooling, but you might be unfamiliar with the duties you are to perform.
In exchange for the many benefits you will enjoy as a favored of Lathander, you will have a few tasks to perform while here. They are humble, but very important.
You are to lend your wisdom to the wounded and afflicted, those that are suffering from a misdirection of the heart. Guide them in the light of the Morninglord's glory.
We shall introduce you slowly to the work. I shall send you someone that needs the guidance of Lathander, and then we shall evaluate how you have done.

name: Fulfill Your Duties to Talos
objective: speak to the believers of Talos
first_tasks: give guidance to the believers of Talos who seek the guidance of Talos

quest_giver.name: Acolyte Vilon
quest_giver.description: a priest of Talos, who hands the player the player's duties to Talos

characters.name: Talos, the Storm Lord
characters.description: an evil god of thunder and destruction

tools: the player is a favored of Talos
Acolyte Vilon sends the player a few believers who need the guidance of Talos
description:
Chosen of Talos! Over here! I, Acolyte Vilon, have words for you about your duties within the church!
As a favored of Talos, you will hear questions from the mewling dogs that seek the guidance of the Storm Lord. These weaklings seek guidance, and you are to give it. These worms are barely worthy of stepping upon the floor of the house of the Storm Lord! Nevertheless, you will hear them!
We all take our turn guiding the foolish. I shall send a few your way, and if you do well, perhaps you will not need to speak to any more. We shall see.
For now, guide them in the way of Talos. You must do what is best for the church, and that is all. Anything less and you will have your honors stripped.
Clear?

name: Coran and the Wolfweres
objective: save Safana from wolfweres

quest_giver.name: Coran
quest_giver.description: the player's old friend, and a strong warrior

groups.name: wolfweres
groups.description: wolves that can turn into humanoids

tools: Coran and Safana were traveling Forest of Tethir: Safana was kidnapped by wolfweres
Coran managed to escape from wolfweres
Coran will go with the player: Coran will help the player save Safana
description:
Hail, good friend! I am most pleased to see you here! Your timing could not be better, as I, Coran, am in most dire need!
I was traveling Forest of Tethir with my beloved Safana... and now she is kidnapped! It is dreadful! Two days ago, we were beset by giant wolves... wolfweres, I fear. They tried to take us both, but I was able to escape. Safana, however, was not so fortunate. I tracked them to an encampment east of here, but even a great warrior such as myself cannot beat them alone.
We must save her and strike a blow against the foul werebeasts! Together, we shall be unstoppable!

name: Dealing with the Trademeet Genies
objective: investigate the issue with the Dao genies
first_tasks: talk with Guildmistress Busya about what needs to be done

groups.name: Dao genies
groups.description: a group of genies from Calimshan

tools: Dao genies came to Trademeet
Dao genies are hunting Ihtafeer
Dao genies won't allow trade to occur in Trademeet until Ihtafeer's head is delivered to them
description:
My name is Lord Logan Coprith, and I am the High Merchant of Trademeet.
A group of Dao genies from Calimshan arrived to Trademeet a while ago. They and their gold were welcome enough at first... But in only weeks, they have taken all business and put a stop to it. They are hunting a rakshasa named Ihtafeer and insist that she is present in the town.
The genies will allow no trade to occur until Ihtafeer is found and her head given to them. Why... why they have chosen this particular tactic, I am unsure.
Without proper trade, however, the merchants are penniless. Soon, the food resources will dry up as well, so something must be done... and done soon.
Perhaps you might be able to look into this genie issue for us? Guildmistress Busya in the next room can tell you more about what needs to be done.

name: Find Giran's Mother Within the Circus Tent
objective: investigate the circus tent
tools: guards do not let anyone in the circus tent
description:
sniff* My momma's still inside. They says she can't come out. My momma went into the tent to see a circus show. But somethin' happened, and now nobody comes out. There's guards who won't let nobody in anymore, too. But my momma's in there!
I want my momma! Please find her, please!

name: Find the Kidnappers Who Buried Tirdir
objective: find the 3 men who buried Tirdir alive
first_tasks: talk to the gravekeeper about the man dressed in red

characters.description: man dressed in red, the youngest of the 3 men

groups.name: 3 men
groups.description: a group of three men who kidnapped Tirdir

tools: the player saved Tirdir from a grave

Tirdir tore off something from the shirt of the youngest man dressed in red

description:
Thank you for saving me! I'm Tirdir. I was buried by the men who kidnapped me!
*cough* They held me for ransom from my family, and after my family had paid, they knocked me out. I remember being carried here and thrown into that grave next to another body! And then they buried me alive! *cough*
I don't know their names. There were three of them. The youngest carried me here. He dressed all in red... strange and bright as you please.
I woke up with this in my hand. I think I must have torn it off his shirt when he threw me in the grave. Perhaps it will help you find him.
You must stop them! I beg of you! There was someone who spoke to this man. Perhaps the gravekeeper. You should talk to him at least... he must have seen something!

name: Find Mimic's Blood for Jermien the Cowled Wizard
objective: bring Jermien the blood of a mimic so that he can complete his magical stone golem
first_tasks: find the blood of a mimic

reward.description: a handsome reward: a magical sword

tools: magical stone golems are known to be powerful and dangerous
description:
I am none other than Jermien... licensed Cowled Wizard for this region.
I am working on a golem of stone! A fine piece of magical craftsmanship, if I do say so myself! Few other mages have made the attempt, you see. This type of golem is quite powerful and dangerous... but I am more than skilled enough to control it. Once it's complete, I'll have an excellent servant.
Trouble is, I'm missing one of the crucial ingredients... the blood of a mimic. I'd pay handsomely for some, in fact. Hmmm... you look like the adventurous type... care to find me some?
Hmm. I seem to recall that I've got a magical sword around here that I won in a bet from a certain fool. I've no use for it, but it's valuable. Find me some mimic's blood and it's yours.

objective: return to Xzar after you have found Montaron

My friend Montaron has been taken captive by those irksome Harpers. I would have you enter their building and find Monty for me. Short... halfling... thief... even one of your intellectual capacity can't miss him.
Go to their building and return once you have found him.

name: Find Proof of Mae'Var's Treachery
objective: find evidence about Mae'Var's planned betrayal
first_tasks: show the papers to Gorch to gain access to Mae'Var's guild house

first_task_locations.description: the storefront in the central docks

quest_giver.name: Renal
quest_giver.description: one of the leaders of the Shadow Thieves, nicknamed "Bloodscalp"

description:
My name is Renal, as I'm sure you've been told. Renal "Bloodscalp"... a little nickname I've earned over time. Rather grisly, but it keeps the fearful in line.
One of my guild houses to the south is run by a rather ambitious fellow named Mae'Var. Good thief, but I never liked him. Now I know why. I've had some hints that he is getting too big for himself. Thinking of taking my place, I suspect, but I've had no real evidence to say that this is so.
I will give you papers saying you were being transferred by the Shadowmaster. You will spy on Mae'Var from the inside and find me the evidence that I need. You'll need to reassure Mae'Var, naturally. He won't know who you are, but I am confident that you are more than capable of this.
Just head to the storefront in the central docks area and speak to the storekeeper, Gorch. Show the papers to him, and he'll let you in the guild house proper.
I think you will find the reward adequate. 10,000 gold is no small fortune, though I think you deserve a little more. From my personal armory, a sword.

name: Free Haer'Dalis from Inprisonment by Mekrath
objective: return Haer'Dalis and his gem to the troupe

quest_giver.name: Raelis Shai
quest_giver.description: leader of the troupe of bards and actors

reward.description: Mekrath might have treasure that could be taken from him

characters.name: Haer'Dalis, sparrow
characters.description: a male actor in Raelis Shai's troupe

Haer'Dalis was captured by Mekrath because Mekrath coveted Haer'Dalis' gem
description:
I am Raelis Shai, the leader of this merry troupe.
The vagaries of fortune blow an ill wind over us. One of our members is absent due to circumstances we cannot control.
You must hear our story. One of our actors, Haer'Dalis, has been kidnapped by a wizard native to this city... he has made no effort to negotiate with us. The wizard's greed may have called to him at the sight of Haer'Dalis's beloved gem... something our sparrow would not gladly surrender. So this wizard has stolen both away, and there is nothing we can do. I would ask that you return our sparrow and his gem to us both, by whatever means possible.
The wizard's name is Mekrath, I believe... I know that his lair can be accessed through the city's sewers, though where exactly it lies is a mystery.
We are but a destitute troupe of players, child, and can afford little. Mekrath may have treasure of his own... Wrest it from his grasp if you wish to do so.

name: Free the Genie
objective: return Malaaq's flask to him
tools: Malaaq was bound to guard Irenicus' items and the player's weapon
Malaaq was captured from his home, Plane of Air, by Irenicus
Malaaq will be free if he is given his original flask
description:
I am djinni Malaaq and I have been bound by a wizard to guard his items, and your item it seems. I can sense your touch upon this weapon.
If you can secure the means of my release, I will give you your weapon.
I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed.

name: Heeding the Spirit of the Grove
objective: serve the grove as a leader bringing balance

first_task_locations.description: along the path to the east of the troll mound

characters.name: Nilthiri
characters.description: a shamaness, and the leader of the trolls of the troll mound
characters.location: along the path to the east of the troll mound

tools: the player is a druid
Nilthiri will overrun the grove if not stopped
description:
I am the spirit of the grove, child. I am the water, the earth, the trees, and the sun. I am life and death: the eternal cycle.
A druid who serves the cause of balance is needed. The grove requires leadership, a gentle hand. Will you serve the grove as such? There is much work to be done. Listen and learn the path of balance, the path of the Eternal Cycle.
Long have the trolls of the mound lived beneath the protection of the grove. But a new leader has arisen. Nilthiri the shamaness leads the trolls to chaos. She urges them to expand their territory, and she brings more trolls to the mound without thought to the consequences. If this continues, the trolls will overrun the grove, and nature will suffer. A servant of nature must bring the life cycle of Nilthiri to a close for the good of all.
You will find Nilthiri along the path to the east of the troll mound.

name: Rescue Loren
objective: aid the spirit of Marek of Halruaa in saving Loren
first_tasks: save Loren from Marek of Halruaa's old enemies

characters.name: Marek of Halruaa
characters.description: a famous male druid of old

characters.name: Loren

the player is a child of nature: a druid
Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods

description:
It is I, the spirit of the grove, child.
Child of nature, you are again needed. Balance is threatened, and Chaos is at the periphery. Will you serve the grove?
The grove is young in terms of nature and ancient in the years of man. Centuries ago, Marek of Halruaa established a protectorate of nature in these woods. Now, as Marek knew would someday happen, his descendants have returned and old enemies marshal their forces. A child called Loren has recently arrived in Trademeet. This child is the inheritor of Marek's spirit, but does not yet have the knowledge to use his power. Surely he shall be slain by the forces of chaos if you do not rescue him. Even now he is alone and in danger, his parents slain by an evil that haunts him. You must find the child Loren in Trademeet and fight Marek's old enemies to save the child's life.
The spirit that once was Marek has gone forth to aid the child... but the spirit is not the power that the man once was and cannot hope to hold out for long. Aid him lest all be lost.

We are the three dryads. You must help us get free of this... creature Irenicus! We are Irenicus's possessions, servants, and concubines.
You must get our acorns back from Ilyich, the clan leader of Irenicus's duergar slaves. He is somewhere within this dungeon. Please take the acorns to the Fairy Queen who lives in the south end of the Windspear Hills.

I beg of you to come and speak to him! To see what has frightened him so and perhaps help him!
Tiris is at our home, the one just north of the Alibakkar estate. Please come as soon as you are able to! I so despair seeing him like this! I know I am poor and have nothing to offer, but I beg you to help my son!

name: Hunt the Skin Dancer with Darsidian Moor

I am Darsidian Moor, and I hunt a creature known as the skin dancer, a man-like beast without true flesh of its own.
I must follow the leads I have found here and confront this creature once and for all. Will you aid me in killing this creature of evil?
The skin dancer's lair is just north of the east gate, in a walled-off section of town with an orange pavilion. I intend to travel ahead and scout out the area.
Meet me there as soon as possible... I could certainly use your aid.

name: Heal Raissa's Skin Dancer Condition
objective: cure Raissa
first_tasks: talk to the temple superior about a restoration spell

the skin dancers turned Raissa into a skin dancer: they peeled her skin from her bones and one of them put Raissa's skin on like a coat

a spell of restoration can cure Raissa
description:
Y-you... you killed those monsters? It was so... horrible! They turned me, Raissa, into one of them: a skin dancer. Peeled my skin from m-my bones and... and now I've put it back! They turned me into one of them. He took my skin like it was some kind of coat and put it on. He told me that now I was a skin dancer too.
I... I cannot go anywhere like this! I can feel that magic, that evil, growing inside of me! Please, my noble savior... help me! Wh-when he was... taking my skin, the skin walker said the only way to stop the process was a spell of restoration. B-but he laughed, saying I would never receive it.
If... if you could find that spell, could you not cast it upon me? Maybe... maybe the temple superior at the Waukeenar Temple would have something!
I have no coin. I know such magic is very expensive... but if you could find it in your heart to save me, I would be eternally grateful!

description:
I'm scouring for a band of desperate adventurers to aid me in a gallant task. Come and hear Korgan Bloodaxe's tale!
A fortnight past, me fellows and I were in the midst of obtaining an ancient text fer our patron when a skirmish visited our midst. Vile words, alas, became a lake of bloodshed. So it goes the sacred grimoire ne'er made it to our benefactor's hand. And now he awaits its arrival with a zeal reserved for a grog-blossom in an alekeg. The scuttlebutt is the pay is handsome and worthy of note — sacks of loot and odd magics. The volume sits not far from 'ere, and the bibliomaniac, he paces the floor in the meantime. 'Tis called the Book of Kaza.
The Book of Kaza is in some hobnail's tomb over in the lower crypts of the Graveyard District. It's nae abandoned, but rumors and half-truths only scare the young and infirm. Keeps the curious away, me guess.
Well... it'll take far more than a few shambling bags of skin and stitches to deter Korgan Bloodaxe from a king's ransom! A foolhardy jaunt into a hive of undead? How could ye resist?

name: Intrigue with Jarlaxle
objective: give the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men to Jarlaxle
first_tasks: find the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men

quest_giver.name: Jarlaxle
quest_giver.description: the merry leader of the Bregan D'aerthe

tools: the player entered the pocket plane via a rope
a lich has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men
killing or not killing the lich is up to the player
killing the lich allows the player to loot the tower
once the player has the gems that contain the souls of Jarlaxle's men, the player will be brought back to the headquarters with a rope by Jarlaxle
description:
I am Jarlaxle, leader of the Bregan D'aerthe, at your service.
This is a pocket plane, headquarters of the Bregan D'aerthe, my mercenary band. I hoped the rope would bring you here, and I see that it has. Welcome!
There is a lich who has numerous gems that contain the souls of my men, and I want them back. Whether you kill the lich or not is up to you. Killing him would allow you to loot the tower, I suppose, but however you get those gems is of no concern to me.
Once you gather up the gems, I will use the rope to pull you back into the headquarters here. Easy enough, yes?
You shall receive a bit of gold, my friend, for your trouble.

name: A Mission From Oisig
objective: discuss your mission with Oisig
tools: the player is not a believer of Helm
description:
Greetings. I am Oisig, cleric of Helm.
I would speak with you. I would hire you as a mercenary in the service of Helm. I would prefer a person of faith, but you will be adequate.
Follow me to the temple of Helm. I will discuss what is required of you there. Do not take too long; Helm requires you now.

name: Investigate the Cult of the Eyeless
objective: investigate the Cult of the Eyeless

reward.description: the player will be rewarded if they serve well

characters.name: Helm, He of the Unsleeping Eyes, The Vigilant One
Keldorn
characters.description: a male paladin of Torm, and an ally of Helm, who will assist the player in finding the Cult of the Eyeless

tools: blindness is abhorrent to Helm
the Cult of the Eyeless is hiding in the sewers: the player must infiltrate the sewers and find a hidden passage leading to the Cult of the Eyeless
description:
The task I ask will be treacherous, but you seem capable. Serve well, and you will be rewarded. Display any treachery, and it will be seen. Now to the task.
A cult of the eyeless has emerged: He of the Unsleeping Eyes must know of this cult. The blindness they promote is abhorrent to Helm. We ask you to investigate and identify the cult.
The Vigilant One informs us that the cult is underground and close, but we cannot see past the sewers. You must infiltrate it, as friend or conqueror. You must suffer the filth of the sewers to find the filth of the cult. They are not hiding amidst the pipes, so there must be a passage leading further away.
Our resources are thin at the moment, but an ally of Helm and servant of Torm is awaiting you in the sewers now. Seek Keldorn to serve with you. Faith guide you both.

name: Serve the One God
objective: retrieve an item for the One God
first_tasks: venture below, and retrieve the item

first_task_locations.description: in this area, atop a holy altar

quest_giver.name: Gaal
quest_giver.description: high priest of the One God

reward.description: the player will be added to the ranks of the One God

items.name: item
items.description: an artifact, a part of a rod

tools: Gaal will gives the player a key to the inner chambers
the door to the inner chambers is located a short distance back the way the player came, at the sewer passages
description:
I am Gaal, high priest of the One God.
There is... something that you could do that the great one cannot, despite his vast power.
The Unseeing Eye knows of a valuable item in this area.
The item is a rod... or part of a rod, rather, that you will find atop a holy altar. I cannot tell you more than that. You must let your faith guide you.
If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages.

name: Solve Kalah's Riddle
objective: make Kalah allow you to pass this bridge

reward.description: Kalah will allow the player to pass this bridge

items.description: Kalah's riddle, the poorest have it, the richest need it, but if either were to eat it, they would certainly perish

tools: Kalah won't allow the player to pass this bridge before the player answers Kalah's riddle
description:
Aha! I see a wayfarer has come to amuse Kalah! You must answer a riddle, naturally, ere I will allow you to pass this bridge.
Here's the riddle, my friend: The poorest have it, the richest need it, but if either were to eat it, they would certainly perish. Tell me what it is!

name: Set Aerie Free
objective: free Aerie
first_tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners

first_task_locations.description: in the north side of this chamber

reward.description: Aerie might be able to help the player

tools: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free
description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

name: Investigate the Deaths in the Umar Hills
objective: investigate the monster sightings at Imnesvale
tools: Delon does not have any money
Delon was sent to find someone who could help his home village Imnesvale: terrible beasts have been seen out in the hills
Umar herself might have returned
Minister Lloyd can tell everything else
description:
My name's Delon. I was sent to f-find someone, but things have been gone all wrong! *sniffle* I've had all my money stolen, and I'm lost, and everyone's so mean. *sniff*
I was sent to find someone who could h-help my village, Imnesvale. Terrible things are happening there, and nobody knows what to do! Everyone says they seen strange b-beasts out in the hills. Everyone's so frightened! There's even t-t-talk that Umar herself has returned!
When you get to Imnesvale, talk to Minister Lloyd! He can tell you everything else!

name: Ginia's Tale
objective: talk to Calahan near the docks about taking Ginia and Ason

locations.name: Brynnlaw
locations.description: a pirate town on an island

tools: Ginia grew up in Brynnlaw, which used to be a pleasant town
pirates lead by Desharik invaded Brynnlaw
pirates drove people from their homes: Ginia's father tried to take their home back from the pirates but was executed
Desharik gave Ginia and Ason to Chremy for their father's actions
Calahan could take Ginia and Ason away from Brynnlaw, but Ginia and Ason can't pay him
description:
I should begin with my name... Ginia. I grew up here in Brynnlaw.
Things have not always been like this. Brynnlaw was once a pleasant town, though my memories may be influenced by happier times in my own life.
Then the pirates arrived, led by the despot Desharik. Desharik had lost a war with another pirate king. Forced to this island, his ships invaded the town. They took our homes. Desharik killed our mayor and dumped his body into the sea. We were forced out into the streets.
My father could take no more injustice. He tried to get back into our house and was executed for breaking the law of the pirates. Once they've stolen something, the owner has no claim on it.
Desharik said that we would have to pay for our father's "crime." He gave us to Chremy, his lieutenant, as a reward for service. He put me to work as a courtesan for the drunken pirates. It's horrible, traveler! He says that he'll kill my brother Ason if I don't do it.
There is no escape for Ason and me. There is a smuggler who will take us, but we cannot afford to pay him. There is nowhere to run on this island.
Chremy can be found near the inn. The smuggler's name is Calahan. I hope that Calahan will take us with him when you kill Chremy. He will be near the docks. Please be careful!

name: Lissa's Daughter Needs Healing
objective: heal Jaella
first_tasks: find out what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition

characters.name: Jaella
characters.description: a little girl, and Lissa's daughter

tools: Jaella just lies in bed staring at the wall
description:
My name is Lissa. Something's wrong with my daughter.
Her name is Jaella. She's hurt, traveler. I don't know what's wrong with her. She just lies in bed staring at the wall. Won't even eat.
Please heal her. She's just a little girl. Please, you must go and find out exactly what Gerhardt knows about Jaella's condition. You'll find him in the basement.

name: Keldorn Wishes to Visit His Wife and Family
objective: visit Keldorn's estate
first_tasks: meet Keldorn's wife and daughters with Keldorn

quest_giver.name: Keldorn
quest_giver.description: a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

tools: Keldorn's tasks keep him away from home
description:
I am Keldorn, servant of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
My tasks for the church too often keep me away, but my estate is in this district, along with my wife and daughters. Would you like to come? I could introduce you.

name: Adulterer's lot
objective: bestow some justice on Sir William of Thorpe
first_tasks: go find Sir William of Thorpe with Keldorn

first_task_locations.name: Mithrest
first_task_locations.description: an inn in the Promenade District of Athkatla

quest_giver.name: Keldorn
quest_giver.description: a betrayed man, and the player's friend

characters.name: Sir William of Thorpe
characters.description: a foreign noble, and a good man

tools: Keldorn's wife has been seeing Sir William of Thorpe
Sir William of Thorpe has challenged Keldorn's honor
description:
My wife has been seeing another man. Sir William of Thorpe... He's a foreign noble establishing trade here in Athkatla. He was a good man — at least I always thought so until... until now.
My friend, let us bestow some justice. Sir William has challenged my honor. There must be a reprisal.
We must make haste to the Mithrest in the Promenade District. I cannot live like this for long.

name: Kill Roger's Sea Troll
objective: kill the sea troll
tools: NONE
description:
Hmmn. I don't remember seeing you down here before. Me name be Roger.
Oh, the sewers aren't so terrible. The guards don't be comin' down here, and my customers like to be somewhere... out of sight. 'Tis the beasties that are the biggest problem, especially of late. There's this sea troll. People have 'em as pets, and when they grow too large, they huck 'em down here to torment me.
I suppose I could part with a few coins for the deed. I tell you what... dispose of the sea troll beastie for me, an' I'll be pleased to pay you 500 gold pieces, aye?

name: Help Vittorio Collect His Debt
objective: protect Vittario from Dennis while Vittario collects Dennis' debt

first_task_locations.description: the second floor in Delosar's Inn

characters.name: Dennis
characters.description: a big man with big friends

tools: Dennis refuses to pay his debts to Vittario
Dennis promised to pay Vittario's bar tab in exchange for some lessons on the gong
description:
I, Vittario, be in some need of assistance, me pal. There be a fellow within Delosar's Inn there... Dennis. He owes me a good deal of coin, an' refuses to pay!
He promised to pay off me bar tab, he did, in exchange for some lessons on the gong. Well, I teached him, I did... an' now he refuses to pay me tab!
Ehhh, well I be kicked out of Delosar's for not having my tab paid. Dennis be a big fellow... with big friends. I need some muscle behind me if I'm t' go within.
Come... follow me inside o' Delosar's, and let's have a little talk wi' Dennis, aye? I do believe he is on the second floor.
I be a poor, poor man, me pal... I have almost nothing to offer ye. I beg ye to help a destitute teacher find some justice!

name: Recover Dennis' Mother's Gong
objective: find Dennis' family gong

items.name: Dennis' family gong
items.description: a gong that belonged to Dennis' mother

tools: Dennis is the leader of a mercenary band from Riatavin
Roger might have bought Dennis' family gong
description:
I be Dennis... the leader of mercenary fellows out o' Riatavin.
Me gong was stolen. The gong belonged to my mother... it was her dowry and worth a great deal of coin. A damnable lout stole it before my gong lessons were even finished!
The lout sold it to a fence by the name of Roger not too long ago, I do think. He lives in the sewers below th' city, although I knows not exactly where. He might still have it.
Please find me family gong!

name: Locate a Caretaker for Risa
objective: do something to help Risa

quest_giver.name: Dawnlord Arenthis
quest_giver.description: a member of the church of Lathander

characters.name: Risa
characters.description: a shy, sad, young girl, and Dawnlord Arenthis' charge

tools: Risa does not talk much since the death of her parents
description:
I am Dawnlord Arenthis of the church of Lathander... excuse my young charge. Risa doesn't talk much since the recent death of her parents.
There is very little that can be done for her as well... other than to put her into an orphanage, I suppose. She is so shy and sad, though, I am sure it will do her no good.
If only there were someone who would care for her. Might you know of someone who would make a suitable guardian?

name: Madulf Wants to Make a Deal with the Village
objective: tell the villagers of Imnesvale that Madulf can protect them from orcs in mountains

quest_giver.name: Madulf
quest_giver.description: the peaceful leader of ogres, who used to be a leader in the army of Sythillis

tools: Madulf and his fellow ogres want to be left alone
Madulf wants peace with humans
description:
Me Madulf... lead fellows from great army of Sythillis in the south. No want to kill races no more. Lead fellows in desertion. We just wants be left alone.
Always Madulf and fellows be chased and hated 'cause me an ogre! We just wants to be left alone. We come here one moon ago, tries to settle for a while, yes?
We needs you bring word to human village... humans run when Madulf goes, so me needs youse to do it for me. Youse bring word, yes?
Madulf no want death... Madulf no want fight. Just want peace. You tell villagers, maybe, that Madulf and fellows will protect village... protect from orcs in mountains, yes?
We have shield to give you... is magic, from Sythillis's army... we no use. Maybe you like.

name: Claiming the Sphere
objective: accept Teos' special deal
first_tasks: do tasks for the Cowled Wizards

reward.description: the ownership of the awkwardly placed sphere-like building

groups.name: Cowled Wizards
groups.description: an organization of wizards who regulate magic usage

tools: the player recently assumed the ownership of the sphere-like building: by all rights, the Cowled Wizards should have the sphere
the Cowled Wizards let the player operate as a wizard in the sphere if the player agrees to do tasks for them
description:
I am Teos, a Cowled Wizard, and I have been assigned to offer you... a special deal.
You just recently took this sphere, and by all rights we should have it, but my superiors said to offer an alternative. It would seem we have need of you.
That said, they would like to offer an exchange. You may operate in this awkwardly placed sphere if you agree to certain duties for the Cowled Wizards.
It is simple: You may have this place and act freely as a wizard. In exchange, you do the odd task for us, acting when we can't because of political or other reasons.

name: The de'Arnise Keep Has Been Invaded
objective: defeat the attackers at the de'Arnise Keep

first_task_locations.name: de'Arnise Keep
first_task_locations.description: the home of Nalia de'Arnise, a castle under siege

tools: if the attackers have breached the inner courtyard of the de'Arnise Keep, they will be hard to rout
Nalia de'Arnise's father would not leave the de'Arnise Keep
description:
I, Nalia de'Arnise, need a strong hand to help me. My land is under siege, and none of this rabble will aid me! And after all I've done for their kind, too! Please, can you assist me?
There is no time! I only hope that the attackers have not made it inside. If they have... if they have breached the inner courtyard, they will be hard to rout.
I will tell you what secrets I can. Perhaps you will be able to sneak in and attack from a more vulnerable spot. I hope Father is all right. He... would not leave.
Please, hurry to the de'Arnise Keep and find Daleson.

name: Officer Roenall's Corrupt Actions
objective: bring the evidence of Officer Roenall's corrupt actions to Corgeig Axehand

first_task_locations.description: Officer Roenall's home, northwest of the main government building in the Government District

tools: Khellor Ahmson saw Officer Roenall using his authority against the player in a corrupt manner
any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go through him: guards cannot do anything about Officer Roenall
Officer Roenall's personal records may reveal his fondness for gems
description:
I am Khellor Ahmson, a mere guard.
I saw what happened, and I share your helplessness. Any complaints about Officer Roenall must first go THROUGH him, so you can imagine how many get through.
This did not come from me, for if my indiscretion against Roenall were to get out, I should be thrown from the military. There is one way you can get to him.
Roenall is quite corrupt and more than willing to exercise his power. You are not monitored as we, so you can do something that I or another guard cannot.
Look to the docks and a man named Barg. Examine him and what he does, and you are sure to see what I mean. You might also wish to pry into Roenall's personal records. They may reveal something of his fondness for gems. I did not tell you this... and I certainly did not say his records are in his home northwest of the main government building in the Government District.
Think on what I've said, and bring anything you learn to Corgeig Axehand in the Government District main building. He is Roenall's commander.

name: Knights Rescue
objective: rescue the knights of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
first_tasks: repel the invasion to the Amnian outpost

quest_giver.name: William Reirrac
quest_giver.description: a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

tools: the player is a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Sythillisian Empire has invaded Amnian lands
description:
Welcome. I, William Reirrac, have been awaiting you. You should know the particulars of your service here and what being a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart really means.
You are aware of the conflict with the Sythillisian Empire? There have been invasions into Amnian lands. We have been monitoring outposts, and all is not well. One outpost reported an imminent attack because an enemy unit needed their supplies. A runner barely made it with the information, and we fear the worst.
You must leave immediately for the furthest lengths of the Umar Hills. You must join the combat and rescue our knights, for they are surely outnumbered.
Go, and rescue whom you can. You have little time.

name: Dealing with the Baron
objective: restore order to the lands of Metrich by solving a land dispute

first_task_locations.name: a neutral meeting place
first_task_locations.description: a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale

quest_giver.name: William Reirrac
quest_giver.description: a member of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

tools: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Metrich wants some squatters removed from his lands: the squatters used violence against Metrich's men
description:
Knight, we have been commissioned by a local barony. Such service to political figures is good for the Order, and you will serve quite well in the task.
It is necessary for us to be accessible in local concerns lest we seem above the people. In this case, a baron has petitioned us to solve a land dispute. Baron Metrich wishes some squatters removed and has cited violence against his men as reason for it. Go to his lands, restore order, and bring favor to us.
The baron waits in a neutral meeting place. He is in a tavern in the Umar Hills, in the village of Imnesvale. Go now.

name: Tyrianna's Family
objective: escort Tyrianna to the building beside the temple in the docks and wait for Hurgis Baltezan to arrive

quest_giver.name: William Reirrac
quest_giver.description: of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

characters.name: Tyrianna
characters.description: a noblewoman, one of the Morningales

characters.name: Hurgis Baltezan, "Hand of Torm"
characters.description: Tyrianna's godparent, an upstanding man serving the god of duty, comes from Baldur's Gate

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
Morningales
groups.description: a noble family known for their work in opposing the slave trade

tools: the Morningales have been murdered: Tyrianna survived her family
description:
I have a vital mission for you that must take precedence over all else.
We have received word of a great atrocity, one that must not be completed. There has been... murder is too weak a word. An entire family has been decimated. The Morningales have been a model of decency in this city, and their work in opposing the slave trade has earned them renown across the land. It also earned them many enemies. This past tenday has seen the family murdered in their homes, almost to the last. It would seem they were made examples of.
The time for justice will come, but what is important now is that someone survived, praise Helm. Tyrianna — she hid in a cellar while all others were executed. She must be protected until escorted from the city. Her survival will be a symbol to persevere in the fight against slavery, despite the ferocity of the enemy. You will go to a safe house we have set up, and you will make sure she remains secure. It is as secret as we could make it, though nothing is ever absolute.
In the morning, her godparent will arrive. He is from Baldur's Gate and will accept no other guards besides his own. You will see that she reaches his care. Go to the building beside the temple in the docks and await him. She should be safe in his care. Hurgis Baltezan is his name, and a more upright citizen you will not find. He earned the title "Hand of Torm" in his service to the god of duty.
The Order shall reward you with a suit of powerful armor for your good works.

name: The Dragon Slayer
objective: retrieve the Holy Avenger from Firkraag

quest_giver.name: William Reirrac
quest_giver.description: of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

groups.name: Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart

tools: the player is a knight of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart
this is the player's final task
description:
Greetings. It is William Reirrac of the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart and I believe it is time for you to perform one final task, if you are willing.
There is an item, a holy artifact, that lies within the hands of a great evil. Firkraag, the great red dragon, looms over the Windspear Hills. His reign must end, and from his lair you must retrieve the most holy of blades, the Holy Avenger. This tool of good has been in his possession for too long. Knight, I call upon you to slay the dragon and make a statement for right and justice.
The blade will be rescued, but so shall the lands that he rules. This is a great risk, but it must be dealt with sometime. Go, and may the forces of good be your salvation.
Accomplish this, and I can think of no one more worthy of wielding the Holy Avenger. In your hands, such a blade will strike deep to evil's heart.

name: Put the Spirit of the Child Wellyn to Rest
objective: return Littleman to Wellyn

first_task_locations.description: inn in the slums, The Copper something, one of the bedrooms in the back

quest_giver.name: Wellyn
quest_giver.description: a ghost of a young boy

tools: Llynis killed Wellyn and stole Littleman
description:
I... my name is Wellyn. I just want... I just want my stuffed bear back...
It's my favorite bear, Littleman... The bad man who came into our house... he—he hurt me, and he took Littleman with everything else... *sob* I can never go to sleep without Littleman! The bad man has it at that inn in the slums. The Copper something. *sniff* He's in one of those bedrooms in the back! I think his name is "Llynis"...
I've... I've gone to him... *sob*... I've tried to tell him that I just want my bear, please, but he just gets too frightened of me. *sob* Oh, please get it from him!

name: Humans Destroying Forest
objective: stop the humans from further desecrating Mairyn's forest
first_tasks: seek out the nature of the humans' quest

first_task_locations.description: Mairyn's sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood

tools: the player is a ranger
the humans have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees: Mairyn begged the humans to stop but they refused
description:
Good ranger! My name is Mairyn... I am a spirit of this forest, and I am in desperate need of your aid!
There are... other humans... in my sacred lands to the north of this place where the temple of the sun god once stood. They have come recently, digging and tearing down the trees... I have begged them to stop, good ranger... I have pleaded with them that they are destroying not only me, but many of the other forest spirits as well. The humans have refused.
I implore you... go to the forest in the north and do whatever you can to stop these humans from further desecrating my forest! You must go to them, and seek out the nature of their quest, if you wish. Whatever you do, however, you must stop them.
I... I have nothing to offer you, ranger, other than my gratitude. May Mielikki shine on you, good ranger.

name: Orc Attack
objective: repel orcs
tools: the player is a ranger
Delon has been looking for the player
Nelleck saw orcs coming down from the hills: he says that the orcs will be at the village no later than three or four days from now
description:
Oh! There you are, my noble ranger! It's me, Delon. I... I've been looking all over the place for you! You... you've got to come to Imnesvale!
There's orcs... big ones! Nelleck says he saw them coming down from the hills. Soon they'll attack! The Minister sent me to find you! Nelleck says that they'll be at the village soon... no later than three or four days from now. You've got to hurry!
I'll run back and tell Minister Lloyd that you're coming! Everyone will be so relieved!

name: Umar the Witch
objective: deal with Umar
tools: the player is a ranger
Delon has been looking for the player again
Imnesvale is in danger again: Umar has threatened to kill everyone if they don't leave
the Minister will tell the player everything
description:
Hey! It's me, Delon. I... I've found you again, my noble ranger! It's... it's so hard to find you sometimes! The... the village is in danger again! The Minister has asked for you!
It's Umar! The witch! She's come back, and she's threatened to kill everyone if they don't go an' leave right now! The... the Minister says he will tell you everything!

name: The Mystery of Monster Knights
objective: discover why you were tricked to kill knights

first_task_locations.description: Garren Windspear's cabin, a short distance south of here

tools: Garren Windspear saw the player change their shape
Garren Windspear observed the player kill knights who looked like beasts: priests of Helm will seek justice and only the player's head will suffice
description:
I'm Garren Windspear. What goes on here? I've seen many a strange thing in my time, but the events of the past few moments tops them all.
Who are you that can change shape so readily, and why have you slain these beasts that become men?
It appears that you have been tricked into killing these knights! Though the priests of Helm will not believe what has happened. They will seek justice, and only your head will suffice.

Still... I investigated. Lastin here is one of the new guards. I caught him red-handed, attempting to take a necklace that belonged to the late Lady de'Arnise. Lastin has confessed his crime. I am unsure how to punish him, my liege, so I have brought this before you.
He is your subject, my liege, so yours is the right to decide punishment, but you are also... being watched carefully by those who oppose your rule, however.

My name be Bolumir, priest of Tempus, the god of battles!
Hahr... it has been some time since I have rested my feet in any place, to tell the truth. I've been wandering for many a year now. The traveling does wear on me, to tell the truth. I've come to ask if you've a chapel that a priest of Tempus might set himself up in... bring the good Word to the folk of the area.
What do you say, eh? If my manner does not strike you as offensive, I would be glad to be chaplain of your wee keep here. I can help your people here much while I stay. But I do not promise to stay for long. Either you accept me or you don't, my liege... that is your choice, and I'll not begrudge it you.

I am Kangaxx, and I have been cursed. I am dead yet not dead.
Cursed to eternal entrapment in this tomb by cruel enemies! Cursed to a fate worse than death! But the curse can be reversed! With your assistance, I may live again. I have suffered for so long... will you help me?
The fiends that did this to me keep me from returning by tearing apart my mortal form and keeping the pieces separated. You must find my body that I might again take mortal form. The pieces are very close! I have no doubt that they lie within the city in tombs such as this. My enemies are predictable if nothing else. Seek my arms, legs, and torso.
I will give you anything you want. Power, riches beyond number! Anything!

We are two imps, little demonic people. We want to play a game.
Okay, big peoples... this is how our game will go! There is five chests here with nothings in them! In front of each empty chest, a famous big people will appear! Famous big people! Oh, yes, powerful famous big people! Each famous big people will give you a gift that belongs to another famous big people... and they will hints to you what gifts belong to them! If you thinks you knows which famous big people a gift belongs to, you puts it in the empty chest behind them, yes? Very simple!
Once you places all five, you comes and asks us! If you wrong, we laugh at you! If you right, we open the sixth chest! The sixth chest has all of the drow's treasure! All of it!

About six weeks after that for rehearsing and then this playhouse of yours should start making decent coin, so long as all goes well.
Your part, my good friend, is to provide the investment to stage the play as well as make important decisions. You'll also reap the majority of the profits. I'll start looking for actors and a play right away. It shouldn't take more than half a week, and I'll send word as soon as I'm ready to go.

Ployer! That... that fat excuse for a slaver, he's cursed me! Damn him! If the curse was tailored to me, it might resist removal by normal means. I doubt Ployer would have done this if the solution were simple.

My very bones ache today. It is as though I age on the inside. Ohh, this cannot go on for long. We must remove this curse!

description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Sir Ryan Trawl. I have heard of you. I would like to offer you the opportunity to help the Most Noble Order of the Radiant Heart.
The task of being a paladin is not easy. Many break under the demands of our path and leave to pursue avenues of life more appropriate to their talents. Sometimes they bend instead of break, twisting their paladinhood to serve their own purpose. These are hard to detect, but when found, they are quickly cast out.
Recently, one of our highest-ranking officers was implicated in smuggling slaves. His name is Anarg, and though he was once a friend, he was expelled from the Order. We thought that the end of it, but Anarg took others when he left. He is a charismatic man, and some of the younger knights were swayed by his words. We could tolerate their loss, but they masquerade as paladins, abusing our good name. They extort, smuggle slaves, and spit on all that we honor. The Fallen Paladins, as they're known, would recognize any of our Order, and some also fear conflict with former friends, so we need outside help in this matter.
The Fallen Paladins always need warriors to aid their illegal activities. We want you to ally with them, especially Anarg. He's the key to them all. If you consider these men a threat, then do what you think is necessary. Gloves of Healing would be a suitable reward for the task, I think.
Anarg has kept their activities localized in the Bridge District. I suggest you search there. May Torm be with you.

Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet.

I'm Quallo, and this thing here is my friend.
You have come for the blade, I suppose. It is as we have always expected, my friend. (He glances to the creature beside him.) Too long in this pit, too long.
The gleam in your eye! It belies your greed, your passion. I've found this blade, child! It is hidden most insidiously. A cruel jest has been played upon us all. My friend here knows this!
The One has left clues for you. Have you not found the clues? Where the topside filth drains, there are the clues. Return to me ere you follow the One's path, for there is much that you must learn.

I'm Lieutenant Aegisfield. I'm warning everyone so as to get the word out that there are guards on the streets. We've had a... a string of killings, and I don't want any more happening.
Bandits I can understand; they are easy enough to figure out. What's happening here is... it's murder, but not like I've ever seen. There's a disgustingly sick person out there, and I simply don't have the manpower to protect everyone. He's been killing paupers, sometimes in the alley where they sleep. They have nothing to take. He kills them and that is all. Not only is it pointless, but he does it in as painful a way as possible. It's... it's sick. He flays them... alive. There has been blood all over the area.
I must go about my rounds. If you find any information about the murders, be sure to let me know. Don't go looking for trouble though.

We must go to the Harper Hold in Athkatla. I have been asked to bring you, and we must go soon. They will allow us to pass the wards of the door, but I must be with you.

I'm Therndle Daglefodd, a merchant.
My child, Bedlen Daglefodd, has been missing for a tunnel's worth of digging. I simply cannot work without knowing his fate.
Could you have a look for him?

description:
Hello once again!
It is pleasing to see that you did not respond to the call of that harlot, Lilith Lurraxol. The woman is too deluded to see the truth, as I said. A commoner that has risen above her station. Our two houses have been feuding for generations. The Lurraxols seem to be possessed of the notion that their family founded this town... what an absurd thought!
Why they would even presume to suppose such a thing, I have no idea. It is sad, however, that the Alibakkars have never had the evidence to prove our claim to them... though it galls me that we would need it. All that has recently changed. An old tome belonging to my family states that there is proof — that proof can be found right here in Trademeet. In the graveyard is a tomb that has been long abandoned... but which also houses the founder of the town. My ancestor. With him lies a large circlet called the Mantle of Waukeen.
Possessing that circlet would be all the proof I need, so I wish to acquire it. I would do so myself, but there happens to be a good reason the tomb is abandoned. It is... haunted, so they say. The exact nature of its danger I do not know... but you are a hero who surely could face its perils and return safely with the mantle, yes? In return, I shall pay you 1,000 gold. I shall give you the key, then, which will allow you into the tomb... the key itself having been in my family for some time as well. More proof, yes? Go, then, and return with the mantle.

description:
Ah! It is the hero of Trademeet, come to see me at last. I trust that all is well? That pig, Skarmaen Alibakkar, did not speak too harshly about me, I trust? No matter. He is a stubborn, deluded fool. Our families have been at odds for generations, you see. The Alibakkars refuse to acknowledge the fact that we are the only true noble family in Trademeet, having founded it. Why they would think themselves higher than they are is beyond my ken. What is unfortunate, however, is that my family has never had actual, physical proof of the truth of our claim.
That has changed, however. A tome has recently been uncovered... an old tome belonging to my family... that states there is proof right here in Trademeet under our noses. In the graveyard, here in town, lies the crypt of the founder... my ancestor. With him lies the Mantle of Waukeen. A pretty name for an old gold circlet. That circlet, however, would prove my claim once and for all and shut those Alibakkars up. I would get it myself, but the tomb is haunted, you see. Here is the key to the tomb... the fact that we possess it is yet more proof of our legitimacy. Use it to enter and obtain the mantle, and then return to me when you are done.
You are a hero who might enter that tomb and retrieve the circlet for me, if you are willing. In return, I will pay you 1,000 gold. What do you say, my hero?

description:
I am Tolgerias, a proud member of the Amnian Cowled Wizards.
This matter must be handled with discretion and expediency. There is something that has been plaguing us for more than a week now and has become quite alarming.
You know of the prevailing attitude against magic here in Amn, yes? Well, amongst some it is even worse than that... a burning, palpable hatred. One particular man here in Athkatla has murdered two of our number in cold blood. He is currently in hiding, and we need you to track the fellow down. We have been unable to do so, much to our frustration. Cowled Wizards cannot be assaulted without repercussions or it will lead to... serious problems.
He is Valygar Corthala, last son of a wealthy family and a true brute. Ask around and you may discover if he is hiding within the city or someplace else. He has a home here in the Docks District, or he may have fled to the Umar Hills. His friends and servants will not speak to us, but they may to you.
We do not ask that you commit any murder. We wish Valygar be delivered to us, that is all. He will likely resist, so if you must kill him, so be it. But if you do kill him, I simply must have his body. Valygar must be delivered to us whether he is dead or alive. You understand, yes?

description:
My name is Ama, and I am Shadowmaster of Eastern Esmeltaran.
I would like you to participate in a little rendezvous and help in the removal of a pest. There is a government official, Sir Greshal, causing us no end of trouble with his tariffs and spot checks on caravans. This fool thinks he can stifle the thieving trade of an entire city. He has been trying to muscle into a relationship with the Shadow Thieves, and while we could pay, it is better that we send a message to any of his cohorts. I have come here with a promise of granting his wishes, but I only want to lure him away from his palisade defenses. This is where you come in.
Sir Greshal wishes to be introduced to a contact here in the city, and that contact will be you. The meeting is already set up, and when he arrives, we will take him by surprise. You are known somewhat in this place, if not as a guildmaster. He will believe you are a legitimate contact. He seems willing to believe anything, so long as it is theatrical.
It will be any evening that is best for you. I will await you in Waukeen's Promenade after dark and then dispense a runner to get Sir Greshal. The suddenness will seem dramatic to him.

description:
My name is Captain Samand, and I'm a very busy man right now.
A few days ago, someone opened a secret gate into the town — Saradush could easily have been overrun. We just discovered the traitor was a young man named Mateo. There's no doubt in my mind that *someone* betrayed us. The enemy came through a small sewer outlet that was protected by both a locked iron grate and several powerful magical wards. There is no way to open that entrance from the outside. But Mateo is a faithful soldier, not the type of man to betray Saradush.
An alarm was raised, and my soldiers arrived only a few moments after the gate was opened. We found three soldiers in the area: Mateo, Ardic Santele, and the merchant Kiser Jhaeri. We didn't get a chance to complete our investigations. Ardic, the son of the Countess Santele, disappeared. He was our primary witness. Our attention was focused on the vile Kiser Jhaeri, but we had no proof. Then the countess told us that Ardic, her son, had implicated Mateo before he disappeared.
If you wish to investigate further, I will not stand in your way. Speak to Mateo in his cell. The jailer will let you see him.

description:
Lazarus Librarus at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected Hectan... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that Hectan was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief Hectan was involved — I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. Hectan can usually be found in the Tankard Tree if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed.

description:
Welcome to my humble accommodations, adventurer. Will you hear out my tale?
As I said before, my name is Marlowe... I hail from Calimshan to the south, where I was a merchant. A successful one. I... suppose that is where I first came into contact with Vongoethe.
Vongoethe is a lich, adventurer. A powerful one. In Calimshan, there are many strange wonders of magic, and Vongoethe is not out of place. It is he who has chased us here, hunting us mercilessly. Vongoethe desired my poor Malla, my daughter. She is the young woman here on the bed. A... a good girl, a virgin and pure of heart. He desired her soul, he said, so I fled Calimshan with her. But he caught up to us nevertheless. And somehow he has taken her soul despite my efforts! She... she lies near death, and there is nothing the local priestess can do to help her. I know Vongoethe is in the cavern that serves as a graveyard in this place. I told the monks about him... but they sealed off the cavern rather than somehow getting my daughter's soul back as I had hoped.
Malla is the world to me! And I do not know how much longer Vongoethe will remain trapped in that cavern... he could already be loose! He will kill me and keep Malla's soul, I am sure of it!
Getting inside the cavern is not a problem. I... paid the guard there what little money I have left. I had thought to... try and get Malla's soul myself. But the guard will let in whomever I ask him to.
I have no coin left to offer you. I have bankrupted myself in trying to flee the lich's reach. But... Vongoethe himself is a powerful wizard. Surely he has items that would interest you, that you could take from him!

The leader of this rival guild, Bodhi by name, made a daring attack upon us. She can only be a vampire, and I suspect many of her servants are as well. The time has come to strike back to protect our people and the city she has invaded.
